snippet: The conservatives must decide whether they will give the new speaker a chance to make good on his promises — or continue their rebellious ways and possibly get crushed.
abstract: Members of hard-line conservative 40-member House Freedom Caucus overwhelmingly vote for Rep Paul D Ryan to become speaker of House; vote puts them in something of bind as Ryan has made it clear his election-year agenda will require bipartisan efforts; while many say they are heartened by way Ryan has emphasized importance of their concerns, some are wary of strong hand Ryan has to play.
lead_paragraph: The conservatives must decide whether they will give the new speaker a chance to make good on his promises — or continue their rebellious ways and possibly get crushed.

headline.print_headline: Ryan’s Words Encourage and Test the G.O.P.’s Hard Right
headline.main: Paul Ryan Expects Tea Party Aid, but Hard-Liners Also Gain
